solution_line_template: John wants to buy {num_chips_packets} packets of chips, which will cost him {num_chips_packets} * {cost_per_chip_packet} = $<<{num_chips_packets}*{cost_per_chip_packet}={cost_chips}>>{cost_chips}.
So John would have {total_money} - {cost_chips} = $<<{total_money}-{cost_chips}={money_left}>>{money_left} left for the corn chips.

John could buy for the rest of the money {money_left} / {cost_per_corn_chip_packet} = <<{money_left}/{cost_per_corn_chip_packet}={num_corn_chips_packets}>>{num_corn_chips_packets} packets of corn chips.
